page.title: 12CLUBS IN N.FERRIBY.
page.content: On the second Thursday of every month some{PENSIONERS}gather in a welfare{CLUB}in Brough.Around 200 are members and around half turn up every time.Membership of the club costs 25 pence and members talk and have guest speakers. Bingo and raffle help to finance it. Eight years ago the club was started and now draws people from surrounding areas including North Ferriby. The{WIVES' GROUP}get together because most of the women don't get to see each other often, so they meet every fortnight on Wednesdays in the Methodist Church school room. They have people in for talks on different subjects.They have trips sometimes.It costs one pound for a yearly membership.There are about 30 members.
